alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chinle Valley; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 13 at 2:25PM MST until February 15 at 6:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TUESDAY TO 6 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches, with up to 12 inches over the highest elevations. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Areas near Buffalo Pass, Chinle, Dilkon, Eagar- Springerville, Ganado, Holbrook, Kayenta, Kykotsmovi, Saint Johns, Shonto, Snowflake-Taylor, Window Rock and Winslow. * WHEN...From noon Tuesday to 6 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery and snow-covered road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. Snow forecast from noon Tuesday to 6 AM Wednesday: Buffalo Pass 7 to 11 inches Chinle 3 to 5 inches Dilkon 2 to 4 inches Eagar-Sprgrvlle 4 to 6 inches Ganado 4 to 6 inches Holbrook 2 to 4 inches Kayenta 2 to 4 inches Kykotsmovi 2 to 4 inches Saint Johns 4 to 6 inches Shonto 4 to 6 inches Snowflake-Taylr 4 to 8 inches Window Rock 4 to 8 inches Winslow 1 to 3 inches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
